natural problem: When Frederick was born, his grandparents gave him a gift of $\$2000$, which was invested at a simple interest rate of $5\%$ per year.  How much money will Frederick have when he can collect the money at the age of $18$?  (Assume no money is added to the account besides the interest.)
natural solution: If the interest is simple, then Frederick's money grows by $\allowbreak .05(2000)=100$ dollars per year. This means he gained $18\times100=\$1800$, so he has a total of $2000+1800=\boxed{\$3800}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P R T :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 2000"
and h1 : "R = 0.05"
and h2 : "T = 18"
shows  "P * (1 + R * T) = 3800"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 When Frederick was born, his grandparents gave him a gift of $\$2000$, which was invested at a simple interest rate of $5\%$ per year.  How much money will Frederick have when he can collect the money at the age of $18$?  (Assume no money is added to the account besides the interest.) The final Answer is \$3800
 ### Proof
 If the interest is simple, then Frederick's money grows by $\allowbreak .05(2000)=100$ dollars per year. This means he gained $18\times100=\$1800$, so he has a total of $2000+1800=\boxed{\$3800}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes P R T :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 2000"
and h1 : "R = 0.05"
and h2 : "T = 18"
shows  "P * (1 + R * T) = 3800"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If you invest $2000 at an annual interest rate of 5% and let the investment grow for 18 years, what will be the total value of the investment? The final answer is $3800.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes principal rate time interest_amount final_amount :: real
assumes h0 : "principal = 2000"
and h1 : "rate = 0.05"
and h2 : "time = 18"
and h3 : "interest_amount = principal * rate * time"
and h4 : "final_amount = principal + interest_amount"
shows  "final_amount = 3800"
